weather_report:
Subiaco is wearing a spotless sky at midday, the light crisp and unwavering, the air clear enough to make edges feel newly sharpened. Expect the sunshine to rule the afternoon with little interruption and a slow, honeyed fade toward evening; the UV index will be running on the high side through early afternoon before easing later, so treat the sun with respect. No hint of rain, and visibility looks excellent.

It’s a pleasant day if you keep to shade now and then. Choose breathable layers, a brimmed hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen; carry water, and keep a light extra layer for after sunset when the warmth slips away. Good hours for a shaded late lunch, an unhurried walk to the shops, hanging the washing to dry, or a library visit with a meander home as the light softens. Save anything strenuous for late afternoon when the sun’s edge grows kinder.
